children.name: Mozart
children.Description: Refers to the Mozart effect, a set of research results indicating that listening to Mozart's music may induce a short-term improvement in spatial-temporal reasoning.

children.name: Classical Turkish music
children.Description: Traditional music from Turkey, known for its complex rhythms and modal structures.

children.name: Heidelberg Model of Music
children.Description: Associated with Heidelberg Neuro-Music Therapy, a specific therapy model integrating music and neurological rehabilitation.

children.name: Nordoff-Robbins music therapy
children.Description: A creative music therapy approach, developed by Paul Nordoff and Clive Robbins, focusing on engaging individuals through improvisation and music-making.

children.name: patterned sensory enhancement (PSE)
children.Description: A therapeutic approach using patterned sensory input to enhance motor control and functional abilities.

children.name: Neurologic Music Therapy (NMT)
children.Description: A research-based system of standardized clinical techniques for sensorimotor, speech, and cognitive training using music.

children.name: Multimodal Music Therapy (MMT)
children.Description: Combines different forms of music therapy interventions, including listening, playing, and moving to music.

children.name: Improvisational Music Therapy (IMT)
children.Description: A therapeutic approach where clients and therapists improvise music together to explore self-expression and communication.

children.name: Creative Music Therapy (CMT)
children.Description: Encourages clients to create their own music as a way of expressing emotions and facilitating personal growth.

children.name: Group Music Therapy (GMT)
children.Description: Music therapy conducted in groups, fostering social interaction, communication, and shared experiences.

children.name: Individual Music Therapy
children.Description: One-on-one music therapy tailored to the specific needs and goals of the individual client.

children.name: Active Music Therapy (AMT)
children.Description: Involves active participation in music-making, such as playing instruments or singing, to achieve therapeutic goals.

children.name: Interactive Music Therapy
children.Description: Focuses on interactive musical experiences between the therapist and the client to enhance communication and emotional expression.

children.name: Vocal Music Therapy (VMT)
children.Description: Utilizes singing and vocalization as therapeutic tools to improve emotional, cognitive, and physical well-being.

children.name: Group Improvisational Music Therapy (GIMT)
children.Description: Encourages group members to engage in spontaneous music-making to explore group dynamics and individual self-expression.

children.name: Mindfulness-Music Therapy Intervention
children.Description: Integrates mindfulness practices with music therapy to promote relaxation, awareness, and emotional regulation.

children.name: Functionally-Oriented Music Therapy (FMT)
children.Description: Targets specific functional goals, such as improving motor skills or cognitive abilities, through music-based interventions.

children.name: Music-based Intervention (MBI) / Music Intervention (MI)
children.Description: Therapeutic use of music to address specific health outcomes, such as stress reduction or pain management.

children.name: Music-supported Therapy (MST)
children.Description: Involves using music to support other therapeutic activities, such as physical rehabilitation or speech therapy.

children.name: Music Therapy Voice Protocol (MTVP)
children.Description: A structured approach in music therapy focusing on improving vocal abilities, particularly for individuals with speech impairments.

children.name: Active Music Engagement (AME)
children.Description: Engages clients in active music-making as a way to support therapeutic goals, such as improving mood or cognitive function.

children.name: Musical Interaction Therapy (MIT)
children.Description: A form of therapy where music is used to facilitate interaction and communication, particularly in individuals with developmental disorders.

children.name: Vocal Intonation Therapy (VIT)
children.Description: Uses vocal exercises to improve speech production and prosody in individuals with speech disorders.

children.name: Patient-preferred Live Music (PPLM)
children.Description: Live music performed according to the patient's preferences to enhance comfort and well-being.

children.name: Reminiscence-focused Music Therapy
children.Description: Uses music to evoke memories and facilitate conversations, particularly in older adults with dementia.

children.name: Music-Supported Training
children.Description: A therapeutic method combining music with physical training to enhance motor skills and coordination.

children.name: Guided Music Listening (GML)
children.Description: Structured music listening sessions where a therapist guides the client to enhance emotional and cognitive processing.

children.name: Auditory Cueing
children.Description: Uses auditory signals to improve timing and coordination, particularly in motor rehabilitation.

children.name: Self-directed Music Listening (SDML)
children.Description: Clients select and listen to music independently as a form of self-therapy.

children.name: Rhythmic Auditory Stimulation (RAS)
children.Description: A technique using rhythmic auditory cues to improve motor control, commonly used in gait training.

children.name: Rhythmic Auditory Cue
children.Description: Specific auditory cues that are rhythmic in nature, used to assist in motor tasks or cognitive processes.

children.name: Singing
children.Description: The act of vocalizing musical sounds, often used in therapy to improve respiratory control and emotional expression.

children.name: Singing Therapy
children.Description: A therapeutic approach where singing is used to address various health issues, such as respiratory or emotional problems.

children.name: Singing Intervention
children.Description: Targeted use of singing as a therapeutic tool, often in a structured setting to achieve specific therapeutic outcomes.

children.name: Vocal Exercise
children.Description: Exercises designed to improve vocal strength, range, and control, commonly used in speech therapy.

children.name: Therapeutic Instrumental Music Performance (TIMP)
children.Description: Uses musical instruments in therapy to improve motor function and coordination.

children.name: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT)
children.Description: A form of psychotherapy that focuses on changing unhelpful cognitive distortions and behaviors.

children.name: Self-help and Mobile App-based Intervention
children.Description: Therapeutic activities or tools delivered through mobile apps, aimed at self-improvement or mental health support.

children.name: Mindfulness
children.Description: A therapeutic technique focusing on being present in the moment, often used to reduce stress and improve mental well-being.

children.name: Breathing Training
children.Description: Exercises aimed at improving respiratory function, often used in physical therapy or stress management.

children.name: Regimented Prescription of Music
children.Description: The structured use of music as a prescribed therapeutic intervention.

children.name: The Music Genome Project
children.Description: A project aimed at classifying music based on its attributes, often used in music recommendation systems.

children.name: DSM IV 302.21 (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders)
children.Description: A classification system used by mental health professionals to diagnose mental disorders.
